description: Installation of air source heat pump within enclosure; associated thermal store within enclosure; and two timber cupboards for outdoor play activities and storage (Regulation 3 Application by London Borough of Ealing)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings and document title number(s): 1025-OP-PL-01 Rev 01 (Location Plan); 1025-OP-PL-02 Rev 01 (Block Plan and Existing Site Plan); 1025-OP-PL-03 Rev 03 (Proposed Site Plan); 1025-OP-PL-04 Rev 01 (Existing Site Plan Enlargement); 1025-OP-PL-05 Rev 03 (Proposed Site Plan Enlargement); 1025-OP-PL-06 Rev 02 (Existing and Proposed Elevations 1 of 2); 1025-OP-PL-07 Rev 01 (Existing and Proposed Elevations 2 of 2); 1025-OP-PL-08 Rev 01 (Proposed Acoustic Enclosure); 1025-OP-PL-09 Rev 00 (Proposed Front Enclosure Details); Environmental Noise Survey & Noise Impact Assessment Report (ref. 2308058-8/02_v1); Supporting Document "YORK® Air Cooled Scroll DC Inverter Chiller and Heat Pump"; Design and Access Statement; Heritage Statement.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| The individual and combined external sound level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment at the development site shall be lower than the existing background sound level by at least 10dBA, as measured at/ calculated to the nearest and most affected noise sensitive premises at the development site and at surrounding premises. Mitigation measures shall be implemented in accordance with recommendations in Section 8 of report  by NOICO dated 15 December 2023 The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014 +A1 2019, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Prior to use, machinery, plant and equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| The hereby approved air source heat pump, associated thermal store, and their enclosures shall be removed as soon as reasonably practicable when no longer needed. Any potential damage to the building resulting from their removal shall be repaired accordingly.

Reason: To protect the character and appearance of the host property and its surroundings, in accordance with Policies D3 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and the NPPF (2023).
